section1.q3: The missing information includes: price per bushel, total transaction value, and delivery location.
section1.q4: The record is missing: 1) quantity of soybeans purchased, 2) quality/grade specification, 3) payment terms.

section2.q2: 1) FIFO - ensures oldest inventory is used first, reducing spoilage. 2) LIFO - useful for tax purposes when prices are rising. 3) Weighted Average - simplifies inventory valuation by averaging costs.

section3.q2: Information must include: country of origin, shipment details, phytosanitary certificate, and customs declaration.
section3.q3: Reporting is required to the FDA and USDA. The FDA requires monthly reporting of raw milk purchases under the Grade A Pasteurized Milk Ordinance. The USDA requires reporting under the Dairy Product Mandatory Reporting Program. Deadlines are typically within 7 days of the end of the reporting period.

possible_causes: Spoilage or loss due to improper storage

reconciliation_methods: Verify supplier statements and match with internal records
Review transaction logs for unrecorded credits
Adjust records to reflect accurate payable amounts

section5.q3: Documentation must include: organic certification certificate, transaction certificates for each shipment, and records of supplier audits.
section5.q5: Immediate steps: 1) Contact the seller to obtain the missing licensing information. 2) Update the transaction record with the obtained information. 3) Implement a checklist for future transactions to ensure all required documentation is collected.
